text: We have a custom module called “page settings” which is above the header section that defines on-page styles if that is what your asking
Hi all, does anyone know of a way to send follow up emails for whitepaper downloads using ONE external form depending on which whitepaper they're viewing?
You could add a hidden field and then populate that with the whitepaper name or whatever with javascript. Then, set up a workflow based on that field.
Hi <@U3A4KEWK1> That's what we set up, but the hidden token is not dynamically feeding the whitepaper to the follow up email.  It feeds into the form submission notification though
<@U3A4KEWK1> in the workflow -- should the hidden field property be set to known?  Or to the actual download link for the workflow to trigger?
Setting it to the download link would be an easy way to handle it, though a savvy user could get that link without filling out the form if they really wanted to if you were doing that, I suppose
You could also just put in an ID number or the title of the download or something, and then set up a workflow that checks that contact property when the form is filled out
"if download_id = 5, send this email" or something
I'm not amazingly familiar with the specifics of workflows, I don't do a lot of those, but I think you can do that
Okay, thanks for the tip -- I'm guessing the download_id property would be set up using JS too?

Yeah, so you'd add a hidden field that's unique to the download and then on each page you'd have that fill in with some js. I'd add that to the onFormReady function in the embed code, if possible: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>
